result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

To linked case #15CM521.  ds/cp

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Allen.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, this case is dismissed and read in for sentencing in 15CM521; bond is applied to costs in 15CM521, any remainder to be returned to poster.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
to modify conditions of bond; filed by Atty J Allen.

Minutes:  15CM521/15CM980.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty James Allen.  Atty Allen recently appointed.  DA PTC 2/12/16 @ 1:15pm, FPT 3/3/16 @ 8:15am.  Defense filed a bond motion; requests the no contact order be lifted w/complaining witness.  Complaining witness present - also wishes to have contact w/deft.  State objects to any change in the no contact order.  Court will amend the bond - to reflect "no violent contact" between the parties.  In addition, deft shall not be on the premises of complaining witnesses bond.
Atty:  J Allen
